hanzi-su-wiki:
濁

Значения

Становиться мутным, озвончаться (о согласных); делать неясным, мутить

Мнемоника

Червяк 虫. Вверху — голова, ниже — туловище 勹. Водится только в мутной воде 氵, где грязно.

Варианты

浊
purpleculture_pinyin:
zhuó
turbid; muddy; impure
мутный; мутный; нечистый

濁濁RS
浊浊		muddy, turbid, dirty, filthy
  • the muddy waters 氵 of sechwan 蜀
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 浊)
Antonyms: 清
Ideographic: A pond 氵 growing scum 蜀
purpleculture_examples: 濁流 [ zhuó liú ]: turbid flow; muddy waters; fig. a contemptible person; fig. corrupt or disgraceful social trends
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 氵 [ shuǐ ] water
    • 蜀 [ shǔ ] the name of an ancient state
heisig_chinese_memo: The fly is wrapped in a spiderweb voicing (voiced) "Help me, Help Me" under the watchful eye of the spider who's turbid (cloudy liquid) venom is dripping like water from her fangs.
heisig_constituent: voiced, water, water droplets, water pistol, spider, eye, cross-eyed, net, bound up, insect
heisig_story: The key word for this kanji connotes the "muddying" effect on a soft consonant brought about by vibrating the vocal chords. For example, in English a "j" is voiced while a "sh" is unvoiced. In Japanese, the し is changed to じ when it is voiced. The primitives are: water . . . eye . . . bound up . . . insect.
koohiiStory1: The fly is wrapped in a spiderweb voicing "Help me, Help Me" under the watchful eye of the spider who´s venom is dripping like water from her fangs.
koohiiStory2: Pour water over the eyes of a bound up insect if you want to hear a pitiful buzz that is very similar to a VOICED consanant.
jp_example_words:
清濁(せいだく): good and evil, purity and impurity
濁る(にごる): become muddy or impure
jp_readingExamples: 濁す (にご.す), 濁る (にご.る)
WaniKani_Radicals: 氵, 罒, 勹, 虫
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: If a tsunami gets into a net that's imprisoning a bunch of insects, the insects are going to get all muddy. The net gets dragged along with the tsunami water and the insects can't escape, so they just get covered in the yucky stuff.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture a net prison full of insects being dragged by a tsunami getting muddier and muddier. Poor buggles!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Unfortunately for the insects, these muddy conditions have created the perfect habitat for ducks (だく). And muddy insects already imprisoned in a muddy net is a duck's favorite treat!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture a bunch of muddy ducks munching on some muddy trapped insects, in a some muddy leftover tsunami water.
Ru_Radicals: 勹 (обёртка), 汁 (суп), 買 (покупать), 虫 (насекомое)
Ru_trainchinese: zhuó: (графема) мутный, грязный, смутный, грубый (напр. мужской), хриплый (о звуке, голосе)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the green caterpillar (蜀) makes the water (氵) muddy
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Water with insects hovering over it is usually pretty turbid (cloudy).  A pond, for example.
humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze inscription from " water ", " shu " sound, river name. "Shuowen": "Turbidity, water. Out of Qijun Lizhuo Mountain, northeast into Juding. From water to Shu."

Bronze is used as a prefix for the name of the rhythm. " Voice " is the Yin law. The " Voice " in Zhong Ming is used as the prefix of the Yang law, which means the Yin law is lower than this Yang law by a half tone or uniform. Zeng Houyi chimes: "The business of the Zhuoping Emperor, the palace of the Zhuowen King." "Pinghuang" and "Wenwang" are the names of Chu music rules, which are equivalent to the traditional "protagonist" law and "yize" law. "Zhuopinghuang" is lower than "Liubin", which is the law of "Zhonglu"; "Zhuwenwang" is lower than "Yize", which is "Linzhong" law. "Historical Records. "Lv Shu" by Sima Zhen and "Suoyin": "Press: There are twelve laws. Yang Liu is the law: Huang Zhong, Tai Fu, Gu Xi, Protactinaceus, Yi Ze, Wu She; Yin Liu is Lu: Da Lu, Jia Zhong, Zhonglu, Lin Zhong, Nanlu, and Ying Zhong are the same."
humanum_full_description:
金文從「水」，「蜀」聲，河流名。《說文》：「濁，水。出齊郡厲嬀山，東北入鉅定。从水蜀聲。」

　　金文用作樂律名的前綴。「濁」為陰律，鐘銘中的「濁」都作為陽律的前綴，是表示比這陽律低半音或一律的陰律。曾侯乙編鐘：「濁坪皇之商，濁文王之宮。」「坪皇」、「文王」是楚國樂律名，相當於傳統的「蕤賓」律、「夷則」律。「濁坪皇」比「蕤賓」低一律，即「仲呂」律；「濁文王」比「夷則」低一律，即「林鐘」律。《史記．律書》司馬貞《索隱》：「按：律有十二。陽六為律：黃鐘、太蔟、姑洗、蕤賓、夷則、無射；陰六為呂：大呂、夾鐘、中呂、林鐘、南呂、應鐘是也。」

金文從「 水 」，「 蜀 」聲，河流名。《說文》：「濁，水。出齊郡厲嬀山，東北入鉅定。从水蜀聲。」 金文用作樂律名的前綴。「 濁 」為陰律，鐘銘中的「 濁 」都作為陽律的前綴，是表示比這陽律低半音或一律的陰律。曾侯乙編鐘：「濁坪皇之商，濁文王之宮。」「坪皇」、「文王」是楚國樂律名，相當於傳統的「蕤賓」律、「夷則」律。「濁坪皇」比「蕤賓」低一律，即「仲呂」律；「濁文王」比「夷則」低一律，即「林鐘」律。《史記．律書》司馬貞《索隱》：「按：律有十二。陽六為律：黃鐘、太蔟、姑洗、蕤賓、夷則、無射；陰六為呂：大呂、夾鐘、中呂、林鐘、南呂、應鐘是也。」

Bronze is used as a prefix for the name of the rhythm. " Voice" is the Yin law. The " Voice" in Zhong Ming is used as the prefix of the Yang law, which means the Yin law is lower than this Yang law by a half tone or uniform. Zeng Houyi chimes: "The business of the Zhuoping Emperor, the palace of the Zhuowen King." "Pinghuang" and "Wenwang" are the names of Chu music rules, which are equivalent to the traditional "protagonist" law and "yize" law. "Zhuopinghuang" is lower than "Liubin", which is the law of "Zhonglu"; "Zhuwenwang" is lower than "Yize", which is "Linzhong" law. "Historical Records. 濁字的基本解释

濁
zhuó
见“浊”。

濁字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zhuó］
［《廣韻》直角切，入覺，澄。］
“浊1”的繁体字。
(1)液体浑浊。与“清”相对。
(2)脏；不干净。
(3)混乱；昏乱。
(4)贪鄙；卑污。
(5)暗，昏暗。
(6)指天气沉闷。
(7)厚重。
(8)中国古代音乐术语。指低而长的音。相对于“清”而言。
(9)指音质厚重低沉。
(10)佛教语。指尘世中的灾业。
(11)凡俗，凡庸。参见“濁骨凡胎”、“濁質凡姿”。
(12)语音学名词。即浊音。
(13)毕星的别名。
(14)水名。源出山东省益都县（今青州市）西，北流注入小清河。又名溷水、北阳水。
(15)水名。源出甘肃省西和县，今名白水江。
(16)水名。古湟水，在今河南省巩县境。
(17)水名。今江西省西部的锦江，古又名蜀水。源出湘赣交界处的慈化，注入赣江。
(18)水名。古淯水西部支流。疑即今之刁河。源出河南省内乡县西。
(19)姓。汉有浊贤。见《汉书·元后传》。

濁字的康熙字典解释

【巳集上】【水字部】　濁； 康熙笔画：17； 页码：页654第19
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?直角切，音濯。水名。【說文】水出齊郡屬嬀山。　又【括地志】濁水，源出蒲州解縣東北平地。　又【水經注】濁水，上承雲陽縣東大黑泉。　又【水經注】南昌有濁水。　又水不淸也。【詩·邶風】涇以渭濁。　又星名。【爾雅·釋天】濁謂之畢。【史記·律書】濁者，觸也。　又姓。【史記·貨殖傳】濁氏連騎。　又【集韻】竹角切，音斲。人名。【史記·孔子世家】主於子路妻兄顏濁鄒家。　又【韻補】叶昌六切，音逐。【前漢·潁川歌】潁水濁，灌氏族。

濁字的源字形

字源演变：

金文小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
濁字的起名意思

暂无。

turbidity
Basic explanation of words
turbidity
zhuó
See "turbidity".
turbidity
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［zhuó］
["Guangyun" cut at right angles, enter the senses, and clear. ]
The traditional characters of "濃1".
(1) The liquid is turbid. Contrast with "Qing".
(2) Dirty; not clean.
(3) Confusion; confusion.
(4) Greedy; despicable.
(5) Dark and dim.
(6) Refers to the dull weather.
(7) Heavy.
(8) Ancient Chinese musical terms. Refers to low and long notes. Relative to "Qing".
(9) Refers to the heavy and low sound quality.
(10) Buddhist language. Refers to the disaster karma in the world.
(11) Common, commonplace. See "turbid bone mortal fetus", "turbidity mortal position".
(12) Phonetics nouns. That is voiced.
(13) Bi Xing's alias.
(14) The name of the water. It originated in the west of Yidu County (now Qingzhou City) in Shandong Province and flows into the Xiaoqing River in the north. Also known as Minshui and Beiyangshui.
(15) Water name. Originated from Xihe County, Gansu Province, today it is called Baishuijiang.
(16) The name of the water. The ancient Huangshui River was in the border of Gongxian County, Henan Province.
(17) The name of the water. Jinjiang in the west of Jiangxi Province today was also known as Shushui in ancient times. It originated from Cihua at the junction of Hunan and Jiangxi and injected into the Ganjiang River.
(18) The name of the water. The western tributary of Guluoshui. Doubt is now Diaohe. Originated from the west of Neixiang County, Henan Province.
(19) Last name. There are Zhuoxian in Han. See "Han Shu · Yuanhou Biography".
turbidity
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Siji 1] [Water Word Department] 　turbid; Kangxi Strokes: 17; Page Number: Page 654 Page 19
[Tang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] [Positive Rhyme]? Cut at right angles and sound. Water name. 【Said the text】Shuichuqi County belongs to Zhuoshan.　[Include geographies] Turbid water originates from the flat land in the northeast of Xie County, Puzhou.　[Shui Jing Zhu] Turbid water, which inherited the Dongda Black Spring of Yunyang County.　[Shui Jing Zhu] Nanchang has muddy water.　It's not watery. [Poetry·Bei Feng] Jing is muddy with Wei.　Also star name. 【Erya·Shitian】The turbidity is the end. [Historical Records·Law Books] Those who are muddled, touch too.　Another last name. [Historical Records · Commodity] The Zhuo clan rides continuously.　[Jiyun] Bamboo horns are cut and sound is made. Person's name. [Historical Records · Confucius Family] Zou's family, Lord Yu Zilu's wife and brother Yan Zhuo.　[Rhyme Supplement] Ye Chang has six cuts, and the sounds follow each other. [Former Han·Yingchuan Song] Yingshuizhuo, Guan clan.

zhuó
вм. 浊
Radicals: 氵, 罒, 勹, 虫  (tsunami, net, prison, insect)
Meaning Mnemonic
If a tsunami gets into a net that's imprisoning a bunch of insects, the insects are going to get all muddy. The net gets dragged along with the tsunami water and the insects can't escape, so they just get covered in the yucky stuff.
Picture a net prison full of insects being dragged by a tsunami getting muddier and muddier. Poor buggles!
Reading Mnemonic
Unfortunately for the insects, these muddy conditions have created the perfect habitat for ducks (だく). And muddy insects already imprisoned in a muddy net is a duck's favorite treat!
Picture a bunch of muddy ducks munching on some muddy trapped insects, in a some muddy leftover tsunami water.
